    • Method Detail

      • init

        public int init(int kbps)
        Initialize the FT4222H as an I2C master with the requested I2C speed.
        Specified by:
        init in interface I2cMaster
        Parameters:
        kbps - The speed of I2C transmission. It ranges from 60K bps to 3400K bps. By specified speed, the initial function helps to setup bus speed with the corresponding mode.
        Returns:
        FT4222_OK if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • reset

        public int reset()
        Reset the I2C master device.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface I2cMaster
        Returns:
        FT4222_OK if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • read

        public int read(int deviceAddress,
       byte[] buffer,
       int sizeToTransfer,
       int[] sizeTransferred)
        Read data from the specified I2C slave device with START and STOP conditions.
        Specified by:
        read in interface I2cMaster
        Parameters:
        deviceAddress - Address of the target I2C slave.
        buffer - Buffer array that receives the data from the device.
        sizeToTransfer - Number of bytes to read from the device.
        sizeTransferred - The actual number of bytes read from the device.
        Returns:
        FT4222_OK if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • readEx

        public int readEx(int deviceAddress,
         int flag,
         byte[] buffer,
         int sizeToTransfer,
         int[] sizeTransferred)
        Read data from the specified I2C slave device with the specified I2C condition. This function is supported by the rev B FT4222H or later.
        Specified by:
        readEx in interface I2cMaster
        Parameters:
        deviceAddress - Address of the target I2C slave.
        flag - The I2C condition will be sent with this I2C transaction. flags is a bit-mask of FT_4222_Defines.I2C_MasterFlag.NONE, FT_4222_Defines.I2C_MasterFlag.START, FT_4222_Defines.I2C_MasterFlag.Repeated_START, FT_4222_Defines.I2C_MasterFlag.STOP and FT_4222_Defines.I2C_MasterFlag.START_AND_STOP.
        buffer - Buffer array that receives the data from the device.
        sizeToTransfer - Number of bytes to read from the device.
        sizeTransferred - The actual number of bytes read from the device.
        Returns:
        FT4222_OK if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • write

        public int write(int deviceAddress,
        byte[] buffer,
        int sizeToTransfer,
        int[] sizeTransferred)
        Write data to the specified I2C slave device with START and STOP conditions
        Specified by:
        write in interface I2cMaster
        Parameters:
        deviceAddress - Address of the target I2C slave.
        buffer - Buffer array that contains the data to be written to the device.
        sizeToTransfer - Number of bytes to write to the device.
        sizeTransferred - The actual number of bytes written to the device.
        Returns:
        FT4222_OK if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • writeEx

        public int writeEx(int deviceAddress,
          int flag,
          byte[] buffer,
          int sizeToTransfer,
          int[] sizeTransferred)
        Write data to the specified I2C slave device with the specified I2C condition. This function is supported by the rev B FT4222H or later.
        Specified by:
        writeEx in interface I2cMaster
        Parameters:
        deviceAddress - Address of the target I2C slave.
        flag - The I2C condition will be sent with this I2C transaction. flags is a bit-mask of FT_4222_Defines.I2C_MasterFlag.NONE, FT_4222_Defines.I2C_MasterFlag.START, FT_4222_Defines.I2C_MasterFlag.Repeated_START, FT_4222_Defines.I2C_MasterFlag.STOP and FT_4222_Defines.I2C_MasterFlag.START_AND_STOP.
        buffer - Buffer array that contains the data to be written to the device.
        sizeToTransfer - Number of bytes to write to the device.
        sizeTransferred - The actual number of bytes written to the device.
        Returns:
        FT4222_OK if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.

      • getStatus

        public int getStatus(int deviceAddress,
            byte[] controllerStatus)
        Read the status of the I2C master controller. This can be used to poll a slave until its write-cycle is complete.
        Specified by:
        getStatus in interface I2cMaster
        Parameters:
        deviceAddress - Address of the target I2C slave.
        controllerStatus - Buffer array that contains the to be return status data.
        Returns:
        FT4222_OK if successful, otherwise the return value is an FT error code.
